cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW then NW, accelerating toward the southeastern U.S. coast (mainly North Carolina/South Carolina) through mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern North Carolina (near Cape Fear/Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest threat focused along the North Carolina and South Carolina coasts; secondary impacts possible northward into VA–MD–DE and southern NJ late week
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈9%) of tropical-storm-force (≥39 mph) winds late Friday as Florence’s remnants move northward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at this stage; surge risk focused farther south along the Carolinas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain possible late week if remnants track inland toward the Mid-Atlantic, but current guidance keeps the heaviest totals south of New Jersey.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells will produce dangerous surf and rip currents along the New Jersey coast well before any wind or rain arrives.
